result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul W. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall have not contact with S.C. dob: 7-30-71, N.C. dob: 1-9-94; F.C. dob: 10-18-95, and J.C. dob: 1-14-92; Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victims listed above due within 30 days and must be preapproved by probation; Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Defendant Paul W. Erickson in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights complied.  Atty Tlusty placed plea agreement on the record to amended charge of Disorderly Conduct. DE enters a plea of No Contest. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis exists.  Court find DE guilty.  Court orders sentenced withheld;  1 year probation; court costs; DNA surcharge; No contact with S.C., N.C., F.C., J.C., and M.Z.; Letter of apology to victims within 30 days, preapproved by the probation agent; Counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. ba
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-26-2015 09:00 am
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

ADDRESS INFO for Paul W. Erickson

Prior: W5919 Berg Road, Ogema, WI 54459

Attorney Alec Phillip Nocco in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Nocco indicated that his client could not be here today but could be reached by phone.  Court phones Mr. Erickson and he appears by phone.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.   - rt

Defendant Paul W. Erickson in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $500.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with S.L.C. - dob - 7-30-71; N.L.C. - dob:  1-9-94; F.A.C.- dob:  10-18-95; J.E.C. - dob:  1-14-92; M.K.Z. - dob:  7-16-76.  Court orders bonds as requested by the district attorney and added that the sheriff's department is to assist the defendant to get his medications, essentials and his car from the residence.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is April 7, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall have no contact with S.L.C. - dob: 7-30-71; N.L.C. - dob: 1-9-94; F.A.C. - dob: 10-18-95; J.E.C. -dob: 1-14-92 and M.K.Z. - dob: 7-16-76.  The Sheriff's department shall assist the defendant to get his car, medications and essentials from the residence.
